GraphDrawing

Class GraphDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphDrawing.GraphDrawer

  • public abstract class GraphDrawer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for drawing graphs with different layouts. More precisely, it is possible to draw graphs with straight edges and graphs with semicircular edges.
    Version:
    1.0.0, 31st May 2019
    Author:
    Clemens Hofstadler, Lukas WÃ¶gerer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.awt.Color ARROW_FROM
      Color of adjancent nodes of a clicked node 'n' in directed graphs which have an edge going to 'n'.
      private static java.awt.Color ARROW_TO
      Color of adjancent nodes of a clicked node 'n' in directed graphs which have an edge coming from 'n'.
      private static java.awt.Color ARROW_TWO_WAY
      Color of adjancent nodes of a clicked node 'n' in undirected graphs and of nodes which have an edge coming from 'n' and an edge going to 'n' in a directed graph, respectively.
      private static java.awt.Color MARKED_NODE_COLOR
      Color of a node when the user clicks on it.

    • Field Detail

      • MARKED_NODE_COLOR

        private static final java.awt.Color MARKED_NODE_COLOR
        Color of a node when the user clicks on it. Currently: orange.

      • ARROW_TO

        private static final java.awt.Color ARROW_TO
        Color of adjancent nodes of a clicked node 'n' in directed graphs which have an edge coming from 'n'. Currently: red.

      • ARROW_FROM

        private static final java.awt.Color ARROW_FROM
        Color of adjancent nodes of a clicked node 'n' in directed graphs which have an edge going to 'n'. Currently: red.

      • ARROW_TWO_WAY

        private static final java.awt.Color ARROW_TWO_WAY
        Color of adjancent nodes of a clicked node 'n' in undirected graphs and of nodes which have an edge coming from 'n' and an edge going to 'n' in a directed graph, respectively. Currently: magenta.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphDrawer

        public GraphDrawer()

    • Method Detail

      • drawGraph

        public static void drawGraph(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             Graph G,
                             int size,
                             boolean linearEdges,
                             boolean threeDim)
        Draws a graph G on a graphics area of a certain size. Depending on the value of linearEdges the edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles. The boolean value threeDim, additionally defines whether the graph will be drawn in a 3 dimensional perspective.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn; non-zero
        size - The size of the drawing area.
        linearEdges - Boolean value determining whether edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.
        threeDim - Boolean value determining whether the graph will be drawn three dimensionally.

      • draw2DLayout

        private static void draw2DLayout(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                 Graph G,
                                 int size,
                                 boolean linearEdges)
        Draws a graph G on a graphics area of a certain size in a 2D perspective. Depending on the value of linearEdges the edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn; non-zero
        size - The size of the drawing area.
        linearEdges - Boolean value determining whether edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.

      • draw3DLayout

        private static void draw3DLayout(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                 Graph G,
                                 int size,
                                 boolean linearEdges)
        Draws a graph G on a graphics area of a certain size in a 3D perspective. Depending on the value of linearEdges the edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn; non-zero
        size - The size of the drawing area.
        linearEdges - Boolean value determining whether edges between the nodes are drawn as straight lines or as semicircles.

      • drawLinearEdge

        private static void drawLinearEdge(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                   Graph G,
                                   int[] edge,
                                   int radius)
        Draws an edge of the graph G on the graphics area g. The edge is drawn as a straight line with an arrow at the tip.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn.
        edge - The edge to be drawn. The edge is given by two integer values (i,j), meaning that the edge starts at node_i and ends at node_j.
        radius - The radius of the nodes.

      • drawCircularEdge

        private static void drawCircularEdge(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                     Graph G,
                                     int[] edge,
                                     int radius)
        Draws an edge of the graph G on the graphics area g. The edge is drawn as a semicircle with an arrow at the tip.
        Parameters:
        g - The drawing area on which the graph is drawn.
        G - The graph to be drawn.
        edge - The edge to be drawn. The edge is given by two integer values (i,j), meaning that the edge starts at node_i and ends at node_j.
        radius - The radius of the nodes.

      • markNode

        public static void markNode(Node n)
        Colors a certain node in the color specified by the constant MARKED_NODE_COLOR.
        Parameters:
        n - The node to be colored.

      • unmarkNode

        public static void unmarkNode(Node n)
        Colors a certain node black.
        Parameters:
        n - The node to be colored.

      • markAdjacentNodes

        public static void markAdjacentNodes(Graph G,
                                     Node n)
        Colors adjacent nodes of a certain node 'n' in specific colors. In case of an undirected graph, all adjacent nodes are colored in the color defined by the constant ARROW_TWO_WAY. In case of a directed graph, nodes which have an edge coming from 'n' are colored in the color defined by ARROW_TO, nodes which have an edge going to 'n' are colored in the color defined by ARROW_FROM and nodes which have both, an edge going to 'n' and an edge coming from 'n', are colored in the color defined by the constant ARROW_TWO_WAY.
        Parameters:
        G - The graph containing 'n'.
        n - A node of 'G'.

      • unmarkAdjacentNodes

        public static void unmarkAdjacentNodes(Graph G,
                                       Node n)
        Colors all adjacent nodes of a certain node 'n' black.
        Parameters:
        G - The graph containing 'n'.
        n - A node of 'G'.

      • drawNode

        private static void drawNode(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             Node n,
                             int radius)
        Draws a node as a black circle filled with a smaller circle of a specific color (to visualize certain marked nodes) and radius on a graphics area.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics area on which the node is drawn.
        n - The node to be drawn.
        radius - The radius of the node.

      • scaleUp

        private static double[][] scaleUp(Graph G,
                                  int size)
        Scales the positions of all nodes from the unit square up to a square of size "size".
        Parameters:
        G - The graph to be scaled up.
        size - The size of the new bounding square of the graph
        Returns:
        A list of all old node positions of the graph. To later be able to scale the graph back.

      • getRadius

        public static int getRadius(int size,
                            Graph G)
        Determines the radius of nodes of a graph G in relation to the size of the graphics area g.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the graphics area on which the graph should be drawn.
        G - The graph that should be drawn.
        Returns:
        The radius of the nodes.

      • getArrowSize

        private static int getArrowSize(int radius)
        Compute the size of the arrows w.r.t to the current size of the nodes.
        Parameters:
        radius - The current radius of the nodes.
        Returns:
        The size of the arrows

      • nearestNode

        public static Node nearestNode(Graph G,
                               double x,
                               double y,
                               double size)
        Returns the node of a graph which is closest to a certain position (x,y).
        Parameters:
        G - A graph.
        x - x-coordinate of the position. The value of x can not exceed the value of size
        y - y-coordinate of the position. The value of y can not exceed the value of size
        size - Maximal value of the x and y coordinate.
        Returns:
        The node of G which is closest to (x,y).

      • distanceToNode

        public static double distanceToNode(Node n,
                                    double x,
                                    double y,
                                    double size)
        Computes the distance of a node to a certain point (x,y) where the node as well as the point (x,y) are located in a square with length size.
        Parameters:
        n - The node to be considered.
        x - x-coordinate of the position. The value of x can not exceed the value of size
        y - y-coordinate of the position. The value of y can not exceed the value of size
        size - Maximal value of the x and y coordinate.
        Returns:
        The euclidean distance from 'n' to the point (x,y).
